metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1283 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer overflows in the XML_GetBuffer function in Expat through2.1.0, as used in Google Chrome before 44.0.2403.89 and other products,allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based bufferoverflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted XML data, arelated issue to CVE-2015-2716.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195
chromium-browser-l10n - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195
chromium-chromedriver - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.8.4-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.8.4-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.8.4-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.8.4-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.8.4-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.8.4-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

expat - 2.1.0-7
lib64expat1 - 2.1.0-7
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '44.0.2403.89-0ubuntu1.1195').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.4-0ubuntu1').
expat package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-7').
xmlrpc-c: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
